Speaker: captain medley
Dialogue: The level of arms on the ground really depends. [Answering a question] But no, I'd have to say we haven't had to engage on the ground as heavily as we might have expected.

Speaker: newsanchor
Dialogue: Have you lost any men today, Captain?

Speaker: captain medley
Dialogue: No. One of my Corporals took a bullet to the head, but it looks like he might make it. Looks that way...

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Sergeant Starks was very lucky. A little more to the right and it wouldn't have wanted to come out...

Speaker: major
Dialogue: But he's never gonna be able to remember what happened?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: It's hard to say. Sergeant Starks could have retrograde amnesia or... [lowering his voice] any form of psychological suppression. It's very common with traumas like this.

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Sergeant, you have no surviving family in the States. I'm sure you have friends or distant relatives, but unfortunately we have no record of them yet.

Speaker: major
Dialogue: Captain Medley has recommended you for the Purple Heart, Sergeant.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Can I have one of those?

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: There is help for you, Sergeant.

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Of course there is. Their VOICES start to fade as STARKS smokes his cigarette, blowing the SMOKE upwards and following it with his eyes. He's finished with these men and everything they stand for.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Come on, mom. Don't fall asleep...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You two ok?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Our car won't start.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Jean? Jean, can you hear me? I need you to try to wake up, Jean.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Your mom take anything before this happened?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Yeah, but I don't know what.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] What's your name?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Jackie.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Nice to meet you, Jackie. Why don't you wrap this scarf around yourself and try to keep your mom awake while I take a look at your car.  EXT. HIGHWAY, RURAL VERMONT, WINTER, DAY

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: What do you think of all this snow?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: [Beat] Nothing.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: But I like it I guess.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Hey, can you reach the gas pedal?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Go ahead, turn it on. Keep pushing it.

Speaker: jean
Dialogue: Get your fucking hands off my daughter!

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Mom, he just fixed our car.

Speaker: jean
Dialogue: Jackie, get in the car. NOW!

Speaker: jean
Dialogue: Look, I don't want any trouble, so...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Neither do I, ma'am. I'll be on my way.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Mom, you've got it wrong...

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: You're just gonna walk?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Yeah, I'll hitch a ride or something. [Beat] Let her throw it all up before she gets back behind the wheel.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: What're those?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Dog tags. [Off her blank look] They've got your name and date of birth for identification.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: What for?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] In case you get lost, or can't remember who you are.

Speaker: jackie [still looking at them]
Dialogue: Hm.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I think I can remember what's on them.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: William Starks. [Beat] Thanks.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] Yes. With Starks' answer, the background of the courtroom is suddenly illuminated and we see that THIS IS STARKS' OWN TRIAL. The VOICE belongs to a satisfied PROSECUTION who turns to face a medium-sized CROWD watching on...

Speaker: prosecution
Dialogue: Gulf War   Syndrome? What the...Why don't we   start diagnosing Hard Life Syndrome   while we're at it? I've gotten a   lot of convictions we could overturn   with that logic...

Speaker: captain medley
Dialogue: Sergeant Starks was awarded the Purple Heart. That award doesn't applaud violence or murder. [Beat] It applauds honor.

Speaker: defense
Dialogue: For God's sake, my client said he thinks he's already died once. He doesn't know what's going on.

Speaker: jury foreman
Dialogue: On the count of first degree murder, we find the defendant, William Starks, not guilty by reason of insanity.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: William? William, can you hear me?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: I've given you some drugs to help with your adjustment...

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Well, your condition's pretty serious.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] So they say. [Off Becker's steady gaze] What?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: I'm just looking at you. Does that make you uncomfortable?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Depends on what you're seeing.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: You said you couldn't remember killing Officer Harrison. Correct?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] You don't believe me, do you?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: It's not my job to believe you.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: It's ok, Harold. It's ok.

Speaker: nurse harding
Dialogue: Come on, army boy. Time for some therapy.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Wait. Wait a minute... Please.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I, I don't belong here.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: No. I don't think you do either. [Beat] But neither of us can do anything about that. BECKER barely nods and STARKS is trussed in the JACKET with METAL CLAMPS. BECKER writes some details down, presumably about Starks' treatment.

Speaker: smash cut to:
Dialogue: INT. MORGUE, BASEMENT, ALPINE GROVE, LATE NIGHT

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Take him out of it.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: William. William, can you hear me?

Speaker: nurse harding
Dialogue: That's not enough, is it?

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: That's Kingsley. Old bastard hears us, I'm sure. He just doesn't want to bother answering so he makes us think he can't talk. I know. I tried it on my mother for two months once before she fished out my tongue. Literally. [Beat] You're the cop killer, right?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Yeah, guess so. How'd you know?

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: TV. Helps numb [makes a "crazy gesture"] any active mind. [Sticking out a jittery hand] Rudy MacKenzie.

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: That's too bad. I don't believe in disposable language either -- you know, the small talk, the little talk. Chit. Chat. Useless. The game's something else though. Think about it: What can we trade with each other in the air between us? This... [running his hand through the air] is our court. [Beat, so eager it's sad] I'm ready to throw the ball. Come on.

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: I tried to kill my wife.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Don't you go to jail for that?

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: I tried something like 30 times. There is, as STARKS rightly figures, no suitable response to that.

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: She's bigger than me, and she's stronger than me. And I never planned on doing it. It was always in the heat of the moment. I didn't beat her or anything. Hell, she beat me. But when we'd start fighting, I'd go for the knife. Then she kept threatening to have me put away, and [looking around] she finally did.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Yeah, well 30 times probably would make you seem crazy.

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: Or just plain stupid. You'd think by the twentieth time, I'd have found an alternative method. Maybe a more effective one, if you know what I mean.

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: It's a hard one for me, Dr. Lorenson. [Finally turns to face her, grimly] The world around me, it's shrinking. There's not even room for light to make its way in. [Beat] Da-da-bum! Da- da-bum! I feel like the horseman of doom is coming for me, Doc. Only today, he's not carrying flowers.

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: What? It's better than fine.

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: Of course you can, Doc. William, it was an absolute pleasure. Thanks for playing.

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: Hey...when they talk you out to the woods tonight and invite the wolves, dance with them. [Beat] They don't eat you when there's music playing.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I am. One of the few things I remember doing is eating. So I guess I must be exercising it off in my dreams.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You done with your small talk?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Starks. Must have not seen you coming there.

Speaker: nurse harding
Dialogue: You gonna get the fuck up?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: I'm glad to see you're cooperating this time, Mr. Starks.

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: Fuck the tranquilizer! I got a foot.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: No. That's not necessary.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Let him go. [More firmly] I said, let him go!

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: The only thing your mind is missing is a conscience.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: I'm fine.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Then don't.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: What about Starks?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Should we be what? Trying to change him any way we can? [Beat] Yes.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: [Beat] It's Christmas Eve, Justin. Don't you have somewhere to be?

Speaker: nurse harding
Dialogue: Ah, man, look, It's A Wonderful Life.

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: You got any booze?

Speaker: nurse harding
Dialogue: 'Course I do. [Smiling] And it is the season for giving so let's get to it.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Where do you think you're going?

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: You gonna answer me?

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: If you're deaf, read my lips...I don't need a psycho following me today.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] I'm not deaf.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: [As if she owes him an explanation] I forgot my purse.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: In case you hadn't figured, it's Christmas Eve. You're never gonna get a cab here.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] Thanks.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: All right. [Beat] You got somewhere you need to go, Mister?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I'm not sure.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Let me ask you that again. This time, look around and consider your options.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: [Beat] You got somewhere you need to go, Mister?

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Great, get in.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: So, where do you want me to drop you?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I'm not sure.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: You don't have anywhere to stay?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I don't think so.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Well, where are you from?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I'm not sure. [Beat] I don't really know.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Of course you don't know.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Why "of course"?

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Because in my life, it wouldn't make sense for me to pick up some normal guy with a place where he's from and a place where he's going to. It'd be too simple. I probably wouldn't know how to handle a situation like that.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Well, you definitely didn't pick normal or simple this time either.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: At least you're honest. That's some kind of start.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: That's great. You're not sure where you're from or where you're going, but at least you've got manners.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Well, you got a coat or something?

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Well, how'd you get here?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] I was dropped off.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Do you have a motel or something? Money?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Well, don't you somewhere? Stuff? Belongings?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: No. [Beat] Not around here.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: All right, we'll get to my place and call around, see where I can take you. [Beat] Just don't think of trying anything.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Great. That was our last option. What am I going to do with you?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Nothing. [Getting up] Thanks for bringing me this far.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Where are you going? You'll freeze out there. You don't even have a coat.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I'll manage.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: No, you won't. You'll die of cold out there and then I'll have to feel guilty. And I've already got more guilt than I know what to do with. [Beat] Do you want something to drink?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: No, I'm ok.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Shit! That was one of my good glasses!

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] Yeah, I'm fine.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: You know what? It's Christmas Eve. And you look clean -- I mean, you're normal-looking. [Resolutely, for her own benefit] It's Christmas Eve, and I have a couch.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I'm not gonna hurt you.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Ok. [Beat] My name's William by the way.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: What's this?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: The best I could do with what was in your fridge. She looks and sees a SANDWICH on a BUN in one plate and a SANDWICH on two different colors of TOAST on the other.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I only lit it because it was so cold in here. I'm sorry if...

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: No, it's fine. [Beat, swallow] Thanks.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: You want a drink?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: This is pretty good. Considering...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: So you're a waitress, right? I mean...from the uniform you were wearing.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Yup. That's me.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You like it?

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: [Beat] I do it.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Have you always been a waitress?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] Why'd you stop?

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Shit happens, and your life changes. 'Bout the best explanation of a lot of things that happen. [Beat] So how come you don't know where you're coming from?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I don't know, but I think part of it's...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: That I don't really know what's real.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Well, good for you.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] Why?

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: [Beat] Real is overrated.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You don't think that's crazy?

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Maybe. [Beat] Maybe not.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Sometimes I don't know the difference myself. And, you know something? I think I like it better that way. [Finishes her drink] You want another one?

Speaker: bob dylan
Dialogue: If you go when the snow flakes storm When the rivers freeze and summer ends. Please see she has a coat so warm To keep her from the howlin' winds...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: This is a great song.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: You remember it?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: But hey, who can forget those words? The man just wants simple and good things for his woman -- that she be warm and happy. How hard can that be to remember?

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: May be easy to remember, but not easy to get. Being warm, maybe -- but, look, you don't even have a coat and I still have to chop wood to make a fire. [Beat] And, being happy...you tell me if that's simple.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: They told me I joined the army when I was seventeen. That's when my father died and, before that, it was apparently just me and him since I was born 'cause my mom split.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: So you never knew your mother?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I guess not. But, as of now, I never knew either.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Yeah. [Beat] How about you?

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Never knew my father. I grew up with my mother. Actually, I grew up around my mother. She was great though. I mean, the way she was with her friends... She was this woman who had so much life in her, she had to find ways to kill some of it just to be like the rest of us. [Beat] She died young.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: She fucked herself up day after day and then, one day, she fell asleep with a burning cigarette. [Beat] I came home from work and she was gone.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Yeah, me too. [Softly] Every day for the last ten years.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: That when you stopped being a nurse?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Jackie? Jackie?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Hm...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: What year is it?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] I'm William Starks.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Get the hell out of my house!

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: What'd you do? Snoop all over the place? You had no right. You had no right to go through anything.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] I know it doesn't make sense. It doesn't even make sense to me.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: If you don't get out of my house right now, I'll call the police.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Jackie, I'm William Starks. I can prove it.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: What? Now you're gonna show me some kind of driver's license?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: No, I don't have anything to show you. I'm here from a mental hospital.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Well, you belong in one.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Stop it! Stop it! JACKIE covers her ears and looks at him, pleading with her eyes. STARKS' eyes plead right back.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I'm sorry for upsetting you, [beat] but I'm not lying to you.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: You can't be William Starks. He's dead.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] What?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: William Starks is dead... [Beat] I've been to his grave.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] What?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: His body was found New Year's Day,

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: I looked it up.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I gave you my dog tags.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: No, you didn't. They found William Starks' body dead in the snow.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: How'd he die?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: I don't know. But he did die. STARKS falters under the news. JACKIE looks around, through her now blurred eyes, like she might find some help in the apartment. She settles for the BOTTLE of VODKA on the table, lowers the iron fork and takes a long heavy drink, then laughs nervously as she looks up.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: I know what this is...I picked you up when I was drunk and you probably thought I'm just fucked up enough to fall for this. But the thing is I know what I'm doing when I drink. I just usually don't care. Right now, I do though. And I want you out. Now.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: It's December 25th, 1993 today.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: No, it's not. [Beat] It's December

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: I'm telling you I don't care what time you think you're in. You're not William Starks. [Beat] I don't believe in many things, but I believe in death. And it doesn't give back what it takes. So whoever you are...I did a nice thing, you've made me regret it enough already, so please, just leave.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I'll leave. But look at me. Look at my face, Jackie. I'm not lying. I met you and your mother. I told you then that I'd lost my memory. [Beat] There was no one for miles around so I know you know there's no way I could have known that from a pair of dog tags you had lying around.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Please...

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Happy Birthday.

Speaker: medley
Dialogue: You walk on. They pick up their guns and fire at you, you stay. They pick up and fire at each other, and you walk on!

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: He's got his gun pointed at a kid.

Speaker: medley
Dialogue: That is not our problem.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Yeah, well, none of this is our fuckin' problem.

Speaker: medley
Dialogue: We are leaving this site right now.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: You left him in all night?

Speaker: nurse harding
Dialogue: Shit, he's probably dead.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Don't get all worked up, Justin. I expected some common sense on your part and clearly I was expecting too much. [Beat] Just open the drawer.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Well, what are we gonna do about it now?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: No. [To Harding and Damon] Get him upstairs.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Where's William Starks.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: I'm not sure. Dr. Becker had him moved.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: He's recovering on the third floor.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Are you kidding me? He's not psychotic!

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Then how would you describe him, Beth? Merely rebellious?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: He'll be a zombie in a few days, Tom. His behavior's hardly suggested he needed neuroleptics.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: And you know that from what, a couple two-minute stares across a room?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: [Beat] You sure he wasn't provoked?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: You sure you want to begin making that kind of insinuation? [Beat] I took five stitches during a routine therapy session.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: I'm sure he took some, too.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Yes, they are.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: He's not gonna end up like Casey, Tom. Whatever happened to him is not going to "happen" to Starks. I don't know what you're trying to do here ...but he's not a lab animal, Tom. You can't reprogram him no matter the drugs or the treatment.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Jesus, you really don't let up, do you? Just because you failed your patient doesn't necessarily mean the rest of us did, too. [Beat] Sorry to tarnish your war hero's image, but he is psychotic.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Now, if you'll excuse me, it's Christmas, and I have a family I'd like to see.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Hi, Claire.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Jackie, hi. How are you, honey?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: I'm ok. [Beat] I need a favor.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: What the hell kind of drugs are you people giving me?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: I said the drugs were to help you sleep. [Beat] Did you sleep well?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Yes. You were. You were asleep for nearly a whole day. It's December 26th, William.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: It's December 26th?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: That's right, William.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Yes. [Caustically] And that's the sun and you're on earth. [Beat] And I know you know better.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I don't know better. All I know is that you left me in there.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: In where?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Uncertainly] In that thing...the Jacket.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: We were forced to use restrains if that's what you're referring to.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: That wasn't a fucking restraint.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Actually, that's exactly what our equipment is.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Relax.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Don't act like I don't know what's real. [Beat] I'm not the one that's crazy here.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: [Pointedly] Of course you're not.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: You're just suffering from delusions that are unfortunately part of your condition.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Don't give me that. I know what's real, goddamnit! You strapped me in something and stuck me in a drawer.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I didn't dream it. I may have been asleep but it wasn't a dream. BECKER sits down in a CHAIR, half-shrouded in the light.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: I had a patient a few years ago. His name was Ted Casey...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I don't give a shit about your patient!

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: I wasn't pausing to see if you did. [Beat] But, incidentally, you should, because you're birds of a feather.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Ted raped and sodomized a seven-year old girl. [Beat] His lawyers asked me to have a look at him because, after his deeds were done... he climbed into the trees of the forest where he killed her and woofed like a dog. He couldn't even remember his name when I spoke to him, but, curiously enough, he could speak back. [Beat] Ted never went to prison because everyone -- including me -- was convinced he was sick. So he came here.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Then one day a little girl came with her mother to visit a relative and I caught Ted stealing looks at her -- the kind you really have to steal if you know what I mean. [Beat] I asked Ted then if he could remember what the little girl who he had... slain ...was wearing. [Beat] He gave me a look I'll never forget, and, when he answered, it wasn't with a color or any sort of physical description I'd expect. "Oh yes," he said. "I remember it. I remember it well." [Beat] Those were actually his last words I think.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: We are not birds of a feather.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Maybe not. [Beat] But I do think you're in a tree... woofing like a dog. And I'm just trying to help you the only way I can think of.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: I was careless. Happens sometimes.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Hey. You're not supposed to be out here. STARKS stiffens as he realizes he could be in the place where his body was found. The terrible question asks itself on his face: Is this when Starks is killed?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Well...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: And if I didn't want to come?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: I guess I'd ask you why.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Because I don't think I'm crazy.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: You're not crazy.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: You suffer from delusional disorder. That doesn't mean you're... crazy. It just means you're confused. And you're here, instead of in jail, because that was determined to have played a role in your killing of a police officer.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: You were convicted of the crime.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: That conviction doesn't convince me of anything. Until I know that I did it, I'm not going to accept that I did.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: You may never remember at all. [Beat] Your mind's grasp of reality and the real events that have happened to you has been damaged.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: No. The real events that have happened to me have been fucked up. Not my mind.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: [Beat] William, I'd like to ask you something if I can.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Since when do people around here have to ask permission to do anything?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Fine. [Beat] Why made you ask?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Why, what would you do?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: I could try to...make it stop.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: No. I don't want it to.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: So it's helping? STARKS [Choosing his words carefully] [Beat] It's making me feel like a different person.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: You should be careful. You could be killed if they found you out here.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Believe me, I know.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: What were you talking about the other day?

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: I wasn't talking about anything.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Yeah, you were. What you said about them taking me out to the woods...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: What do you know about the Jacket?

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: I know you need one when it's really cold.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Cutting in] MacKenzie, listen to me. Listen. I'm going to die.

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: Mortality's actually a great thing to be familiar with. It means you're sane on some level.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Gravely] No, I mean in four days, I'm supposed to die.

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: [Beat] How do you know?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: The Jacket.

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: Oh no, you're pretty young. Your body'll be able to handle a lot more of it than you think...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: No. [Beat] I mean I found out while I was in it that my body's gonna be found in four days.

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: What are you two yappin' about?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Yeah, it is.

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: You know something? You're two fucking freaks is what you are.

Speaker: harding
Dialogue: I want the two of you to shut the fuck up and eat your food.

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: It's gonna be sticky.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: 'Cause Lorenson's got her claws in it now. When she started getting suspicious about me was when they stopped using it on me. Women!

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: So what am I supposed to do?

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: You could still always give Becker an itch. 'Course you might get killed when he goes to scratch it, but seems to me you're saying that's about to happen anyway. [Beat] Just be careful not to walk yourself right into something.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: I wish they'd skip the formality of this annual review and just cut our budget. Our silence on the matter should be enough to appease the civic conscience without wasting an hour we don't have.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: It's the ticking of a box on a sheet of paper no one cares about.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: What should they be looking for?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Where? [Beat] It's Becker isn't it? He's doing stuff, isn't he?

Speaker: sally
Dialogue: Are you ok?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Yeah, Why are you in this ward alone? Where is everyone?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Where are the other orderlies?

Speaker: sally
Dialogue: In the therapy session downstairs. That's what the rep's sitting in on...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Ok, listen. I want you to get out of here and lock the door behind you. I'll go get some doctors.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Mr. Starks, this session is for our civil patients. Damon, please take Mr. Starks back to his ward. STARKS cuts him off and threatens with his gaze.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Fine, Mr. Starks. You can pull up a chair for yourself.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Mr. Jensen, please continue.

Speaker: jensen
Dialogue: Well, [beat] I've been approached by the Federal Trade Organization.

Speaker: jensen
Dialogue: They want me to head the Organization for the Organized.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: The Organization...for the Organized?

Speaker: jensen
Dialogue: That's right. Have you heard of them?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: No, Mr. Jensen. I have not.

Speaker: jensen
Dialogue: That is categorically not true. Bl-bl- blatantly and manifestly NOT TRUE. I've been asked to lead them. But, if you'd heard of them, then they wouldn't be hush-hush, would they?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: And how is that?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: When I was in the Gulf, the Organization was recruiting the Organized.

Speaker: jensen
Dialogue: I knew it! I knew it! Those little fuckers are everywhere.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: They recruit only the best, Mr. Jensen. [Beat] I didn't want to have to say this...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: But these people [pointing to the Doctors] know about it. In fact, when Presidents of this country and heads of state leave office, they come here, to Alpine Grove. They're among us right now! [Looking right at Becker] Isn't that right, Dr. Thatcher? And Jensen, I'm proud they picked you.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: They're always ordering us to stay calm, but how can we be calm?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Looking suddenly directly at Becker] All they do is give orders. That's all they have to do. And no one will ever know. All it comes down to is an order. [Beat] They've got hands everywhere.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Long live the Organization for the Organized!

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Sit down, Mr. Starks! Sit down, Mr. Starks!

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Sit down, Mr. Jensen!

Speaker: random patients
Dialogue: Dr. Thatcher! Dr. Becker!

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: Starks, you're like a mule. You're real stubborn. But there's ways of fixin' that. All you need is a good stick. [Beat] Here's your stick.

Speaker: tenny
Dialogue: You ever been to jail?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: tenny
Dialogue: It's worse than war. It's worse than anywhere you've ever been.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I doubt it. [Beat] I don't think prison's so bad you don't want to remember it...

Speaker: tenny
Dialogue: Well, I've never been to war, but I'm sure as hell not going back to prison.

Speaker: officer harrison
Dialogue: Gentlemen, I'm gonna need you to step out of the car, with your hands at your side please.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Ok, sir. I was just asking what for.

Speaker: officer harrison
Dialogue: This is a stolen vehicle you're driving. Now put your hands in the air, out where I can see 'em.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Jesus Christ, what'd you do that for?

Speaker: tenny
Dialogue: Man, if you're so deaf and dumb, you ain't even worth a fucking bullet.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: I'll be off in 15 minutes. Can you wait till then?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: The Jacket. That's what they call it, right?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: It was banned, you know... and it led to an investigation of Dr. Becker's mistreatment of some of his patients. That's when they found out how badly he was drugging his patients...

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: But no one knew until after...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: After I...

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: [Beat] You bled to death.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: I don't know how you got the cut to your head, but you died bleeding from it.

Speaker: starks [digesting]
Dialogue: And you're sure my body was found on January 1st? JACKIE nods.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Do you really believe me?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: I don't know. [Beat] I thought I was crazy after you left that day. I died. I still think I could be crazy. But then I replayed that night in my head -- the parts of it I could remember -- and it was like...I don't care if I was, or am. I haven't felt that way in a room with someone my whole life. [Beat] And when you left, all I wanted was...

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: [Softly] I want to trust you. Should I trust you?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Then we need to figure out what happened to you. It's the only thing we can do.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Alpine Grove still exists. I looked it up on the net. We should go there and see if there's still anyone around who might have known what happened to you.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: If they don't take me out before then. [As an afterthought] What's the net?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I didn't kill Officer Harrison.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: How? Did they figure it out after I died?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: No. They never figured it out. I did. Most murderers don't stop to help a drunk woman and her little girl on the side of the road. Not without hurting them.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: His body was found on January 1, 1993, but do you know if that was long after he had died?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: What about Dr. Thomas Becker or Dr. Loel Lorenson? There was also a Dr. Gries, I think.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: What about Dr. Becker and Mr. Gries?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Do you have any kind of forwarding address for Dr. Becker?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: He was the only family I remember.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Hello. I'm Beth Lorenson.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: It's nice to meet you, Mr. Starks...

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: And you are...?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: I'm just William's friend.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: I think we'll be fine from here. Thanks, Stanley.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: My God you look exactly like him.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I never knew my father. Did you?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Yeah, I did. [Beat] He was my most memorable patient.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: At the end, he made me change my mind about a lot of things.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You thought my father was crazy?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: No. I don't think he was crazy. He needed help...but he wasn't crazy. [Beat] Your father actually helped me with a case of mine.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: What case?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: I was working with a boy named Eugene.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Who was Eugene?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Just a little, when we were looking up information about William's father. How did he help?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: It's complicated, but [looking at Starks] in a way, your father let me know how I'd get through to him.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: He just said...that I'd shock Eugene and then things would change for him.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: I don't understand.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: I still don't either, even after all these years.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Do you know how my father died?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: How'd he get it?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: [Beat] I don't know.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: But Dr. Morgan said you were around when my father was...

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: I was. But I saw a lot of cuts and a lot of blows. I'm sorry I don't know more about your father's. [Sincerely] I didn't know about everything that went on here.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Well, do you think Dr. Becker would have any idea?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: How do you know about Dr. Becker?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: My dad wrote some things down before he died.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: That's right. He did.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: So maybe Dr. Becker would know. [Beat] But, as I'm sure you know, the statute of limitations has run out for charging the hospital with any liabilities.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Why would we do that?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Because Becker resigned after the charges brought against him by State Patient Advocacy Groups.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: I see you've done your homework. [Beat] Alpine Grove's undergone a lot of changes since then. At the time, we didn't have the...resources to help our patients the way we needed to. [Beat] Now, we do. And things are different.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I wouldn't be so sure. Like you said about back then, you might not know everything going on around here.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: It's important for you to know who your father was, isn't it?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] Yeah, it is.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Exactly.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Well... [beat] let me know how your search turns out.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] We will.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I don't believe a thing she just said.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Me neither. Who was the boy she was talking about, Eugene?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I have no idea.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: You think Lorenson kills you?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Maybe. I don't know. Seems more likely Becker does, but at the very least she knows how I died.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Let's see if they have an address for Becker. I also want to figure out more about the kid you helped her with.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Because that's the part I believe is true. You probably did help her somehow with the boy and Eugene's name did come up over and over again on the abstracts I pulled.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] There's one more thing I want to see.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: This was the room. They used to hang the Jacket there. [Turning to Jackie] This is where it happened. This is the room I'm actually in right now.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I can show you. It's probably in there.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Maybe this wasn't such a good idea...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Yes, it was. [Softly] My fingers were the only things I could move. [Beat] Dead bodies don't bleed. And they certainly can't claw so hard they dent metal.

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: You folks ain't supposed to be down here.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: We were just leaving.

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: Do I know you from somewhere?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You may have known my father, William Starks. DAMON smiles, remembering...

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: That's right! Goddamn, you're the spitting image. I didn't know he had a son.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: He didn't either.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Did you know my father?

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: Oh yeah, sure. He killed a cop, right?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You wouldn't happen to know how he died, would you?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You don't know any more, Damon?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: My father used to talk about you.

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: Oh yeah, what'd he say?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: He said you were a sadistic fuck that belonged in jail.

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: Look here, I don't like you getting in my face and saying this bullshit to me...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: That's too bad.

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: I thought you said you never knew your father.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I didn't. [Beat] Did you have anything to do with his death?

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: I don't know what you're talking about, man. I swear. This is some weird shit you're telling me... and I don't know how come you're doing it.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: He died because he bled to death from a blow to his head. Someone had to have given him it.

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: I never touched your father! I swear! Damon's eyes are filled with dishonesty, tears and a craven FEAR. STARKS leans in closer to DAMON as he remembers...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You know something, Damon? You're like a mule. You're real stubborn. But there's ways of fixin' that. All you need is a good stick. [Beat] Here's your stick. Live with it.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: How long do we have?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: They told me Becker's in Shelbourne now. I looked him up and he was listed.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: How far away is that?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: What about Captain Medley? He never told them what happened to you over there. His testimony...that coward wanted them to think you were crazy.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I know. It was perfect. [Beat] Erase my sanity and you erase anything I'll ever say.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Of course it makes me mad. It makes me more than mad. Just like remembering the face of the man who killed that officer and knowing nothing more about him. But what's it gonna do for me to find them now? I can't fix everything in three days.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: You've got to get yourself out of that place. They're going to kill you if you don't.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I might not be able to.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: It's not a prison, it's a hospital. There's got to be some way out of there and you've got to find it...

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: You'll die if you keep smoking those in your condition.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I'll die either way.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: I can't try to help you unless you let me. [Beat] I know about the Jacket.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: I'm sorry for what you were put through, and I'm sorry I couldn't stop it earlier. But I promise you that I will from now on...

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You have no idea what's going on.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: No, I do. That's what I'm saying to you.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Listen to me! You don't! The Jacket is my only chance in this place.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: How can you say that in your physical condition? Do you realize that it's because you were put in it that you're as...weak as you are now? Becker's a man who's not well himself.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You don't understand.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Then help me understand. You know, you're not alone. A lot of Gulf Vets have begun to experience curious symptoms. What you have might well be a syndrome and, if so, it's not one we know enough about to be treating it this vigorously.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: This has nothing to do with that.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: ...What you do not know is the only thing you know.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: [Beat] Where is that from?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I don't know. [Frustrated] Remember?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Come on. Tell me what you do know.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] I've seen a time that's not this time. And I'm only able to see it when I'm in the Jacket.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Well, what time is it?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You don't believe me.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Ok fine. Tell me about it. Tell me about the future. 2004. What does it look like?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: It doesn't look all that different.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: The future doesn't look different?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: No. Not for people like me. [Beat] Not in the places I come from.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: What about the world?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I didn't see that much of it -- same as now. I only saw it as part of my own life.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Do you think you're traveling in time? Is that it?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Not everyone in here is crazy, Doc.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: [Beat] Like who? Like MacKenzie maybe?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Maybe.

Speaker: lorenson [matter-of-factly]
Dialogue: Did he tell you he tried to kill his wife?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: MacKenzie locked himself up in his house for two months and nearly starved himself to death before he was brought here. All because his wife left him for another man.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Why don't you help me?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Because I don't have time.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I'm about to die unless I do something to stop it.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: And how do you know that?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Because of the future. I know what's going to happen.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: William, that is just another facet of my delusions.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: And what about your work with Eugene -- the kid? Is that another facet of my delusions?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: How do you know about Eugene?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You told me about him. I saw you and I think you thought I knew something about him. So you told me.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: There obviously is, so what don't you just tell me how you found out about him.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Some part of you suspects -- even if you don't know for sure -- that what I'm saying is true.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: I don't know how you know about Eugene, but these ideas are part of your delusions.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: NO! They're not my delusions! Look, just leave my business with Becker to me!

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: One thing's got nothing to do with the other.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: One's got everything to do with the other. So unless you want my blood on your hands...leave what's between me and Becker between me and Becker.

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: Hey, I brought you some smokes.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Lorenson said your wife left you for another man and that's when you lost it.

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: Geez, how's that for a fucking "thank you"?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Is it true?

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: She left me, I tried to kill her, I tried to kill myself. She was mean, I was weak, I was cruel so she left, I didn't plan it, didn't see it...FINE!

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: Not this luckless little mammal's. What difference is it to them? [Beat, slows down] You believe what you want to believe. One version is easier than another so you make it your own.

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: I'll tell you this though. However nuts I am, I wasn't nuts enough not to know how wrong it was to put a human being in something like that.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: MacKenzie, [beat] what if we are crazy?

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: [Shrugging] What if we are? There're crazier things than thinking up fictions for yourself. [Beat] Everyone does it, don't they? Even Becker. That roller coaster car pops

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Becker does? Are you sure?

Speaker: mackenzie
Dialogue: I've been here for 11 years. It's my neighborhood. 'Course I'm sure. He's as drugged up as the rest of us...I guess he has to be to put up with all this.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Thanks for the cigarettes. You still got a lot of problems, MacKenzie, but you're ok.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: At least it's some kind of bars we've got you behind.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Hello, William. I understand you've been asking for me almost every hour. I would've been here sooner but you gave our little state visitor quite a bit to talk to me about.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: That's too bad.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: It is. But when it comes down to it, you just have to patient with them. They'd rather have their vacation, too, so they just push dealing with our "practices" off to the New Year.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: They make it hard for you to get away with your business, huh?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Temporarily.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Makes it a little easier for me to get away with mine.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: And what's that?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: My business?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Getting away with things. Like whatever I may or may not have gotten away with Officer Harrison.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: You killed him?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: And wound up in a better cage. [Beat] But I still want to make a deal.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: See, the deluxe lab animal treatment I've been receiving -- well, I don't think it's worked. I woke up today and realized... [eerily lowering his voice] ...I don't think I'm cured. So really, what was the point? Torture? I think that's still sort of illegal in some states -- though we'll have to check on Vermont. And, how's this for the cherry on top: it seems my physician is a pill-popping freak. [Beat] Last time I checked, that makes some pretty good copy for a lot of these news shows. [Humbly, deftly] "I don't remember everything they did to me. I just remember the worst parts." I think I should be sitting down when I say it, don't you think?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: I think...I have to think about it.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: I think your story needs a little fleshing out before it's ready to go.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: I'll say a prayer for you in Church today, Starks. Maybe the Gods can pick up where the medicine left off.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You sure you know where to find one?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: I've managed to every Sunday of my life. [Beat] Some of us are God- fearing men, Starks.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: And what does that mean?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Means we believe in doing his work and fear what the world would be like if we didn't at least try to.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Becker, how do you sleep at night?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: You in here. [Beat] Works like a drug.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Nina, William Starks is to stay in ICU all night. If anything is supposed to change, I want to be called about it.

Speaker: nina
Dialogue: Sure, Dr. Lorenson.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Hi. [Beat] Sorry I'm late.

Speaker: talia
Dialogue: It's ok. [To Eugene] Hi, Eugene.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Talia, I need to ask you something.

Speaker: talia
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Have you told anyone about my sessions with Eugene?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Has anyone been asking about him?

Speaker: talia
Dialogue: No. I would have told you.

Speaker: damon
Dialogue: No funny business or we can make this a lot fucking harder for you.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Weakly] No funny business.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Eugene, this is a "TRAIN."

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Come on back down here. Wherever you are...try to come on back. You'll like it, I promise.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: You just scared me, that's all.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Me, too.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Here, drink this. I'll get the heat going.

Speaker: jackie [o.s.]
Dialogue: I think this is his house.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You're sure?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Yeah. I called the number yesterday to make sure. Thomas Becker, retired  M.D.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: They're not here.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: They're not.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: [Beat, lost] No.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Maybe they're out.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: How much time do we have?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: What? What are you thinking?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: There're no cars on this street.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Yeah, you're right. But wait, how can that be?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I don't know. Maybe that's because this whole thing is a dream. How can you have a street with no cars on it?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: I don't know. But this isn't a dream. I'm real, and so is where we are.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Then why isn't there anyone around?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: [Beat] I don't know.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: William! William!

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Maybe he's gone somewhere. He'll have to come back.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Of course he will. [Beat] What day of the week is it?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: It's Sunday.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: So?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Look where these people live.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: They've got lives to be grateful for.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: William, you're not making sense.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] They're at Church. And I bet that's where Becker is.  EXT. STREETS, SHELBOURNE

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You still go to Church. How's that work? Your God just doesn't notice? That it? [Beat, serious] How you doin', Dr. Becker?

Speaker: becker's grandson
Dialogue: Grandpa?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I don't know, Dr. Becker. Can you?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Who are you?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I think you know. Your eyes say you do.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: [Beat] You're his son?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: No. I'm not his son. I'm him. [Beat] What? You look like you've seen a ghost. You can come here and touch me, old man. I'm the real thing.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: How...how are you here?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: You died, Starks. Years ago, in the hospital.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I know. [Beat] You killed me, didn't you?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: No. I didn't. I swear I didn't. I probably helped push you to kill yourself, but I didn't do it.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I didn't kill myself. I died from a blow to the head. How'd it happen? I have to know.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: I don't know how you died. The last time I put you in the Jacket was just after you told me you remembered killing that police officer...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I didn't say I remembered killing him. I just repeated some words to get myself back in there.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: I know. [Beat] I knew that when you came out.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Because...because you came out and said something you couldn't have possibly have known. You came back and repeated three names...

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: Of people like you. People I was just trying to help. They couldn't get worse so I thought, with medication, they might get...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Medication? What kind of meds do you chase with nights in a cadaver drawer?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: It was part of the treatment I intended...I didn't know what the effects would be...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: So, what, you guinea pig sick people to find out?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: The three of you weren't regular patients. You were criminals that ended up at Alpine Grove.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: No, we were patients.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: You and the others didn't seem that way then.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Who were the others?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: How did you come to know their names?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You just told me. The last time I was with you was when I was in the Jacket. I'm in it right now, Dr. Becker.

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: I don't understand...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I'm in it as we speak. [Beat] You're haunting yourself right now. [Beat] I guess sometimes we indict ourselves if no one else does. You didn't make history like you wanted to, huh, Dr. Becker. It turned out different, didn't it?

Speaker: becker
Dialogue: I didn't put you in Alpine Grove.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: No. [Beat] You put me on drugs and then you put me in the Jacket.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: The same way you just said I didn't without my ever telling you. [Beat] And that still doesn't excuse what you did. Just because you had keys to a cage didn't mean you had animals inside. [Beat] You've earned your guilt, Becker.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: That's all you got from him? That bastard helped take your life away from you.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: No, he didn't.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: What? How can you say that? He's the one that put you in that goddamn medieval...Jacket. He's probably the one who killed you.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: No one's killing anyone.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Touch me. I'm okay.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: If everything hadn't happened the way it has, then I wouldn't be here right now, sitting in a car with you, touching your face.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Why are you saying that? [Beat] We don't have long, do we?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Where are we going?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: To the hospital.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Claire, I need help.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: What's happening to me? Why am I getting so much weaker?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Because your body can only take so much of what they're putting you through.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Jesus, what's happened to him?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Lorenson's the only one that could let me out of there. I need something to persuade her that I was there. Get me something to take to her.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Ok. Ssh. Rest.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: No, no. [Beat] Not yet. But he doesn't have long. Are you sure you don't want a doctor to look at him?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: No! It won't do any good. [Beat] Please, Claire. They won't understand.

Speaker: tenny
Dialogue: Hey, Mister, you need a ride?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Where are you going?

Speaker: tenny
Dialogue: I'm going to Canada but I can let you ride with me up to the border.

Speaker: tenny
Dialogue: Can you drive?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: tenny
Dialogue: Great, get in. We'll switch off in a bit.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: William, please, honey, wake up. For me.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Can you hear me?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: I found out about Eugene. The little boy. He's the key. That's who you have to tell her about when you get back there. It's the only way to prove this to her.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Jackie?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: When we first met, when you were 7, where was the house you lived in with your mother? Do you remember your address?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: 112 Orchard Way. [Realizing, in a whisper] You're not coming back, are you?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You gotta stop thinking like that.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Then, where are you going?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Nowhere. [Beat] I just think I'm gonna be sick. STARKS   moves towards the bathroom of the hospital room. JACKIE   moves to help him and he motions for her to stop. STARKS   falters in the doorway when he turns to look back at Jackie   -- like it might be for the last time.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I'm William Starks. I'm not his son. And...and the kid you work with. Your friend's son...Eugene...

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: I know. I know it all. Save your strength. I already know everything you're going to say. [Beat] You're in the Jacket right now, aren't you?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: How...how do you know?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: You told me this was how it happened.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I did?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Who...who kills me?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: You have nothing to fear, William.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Nathan...Piechowski. [Beat] Jackson MacGregor...Ted Casey. [Beat] You didn't cure them. You killed them.

Speaker: sally
Dialogue: Would you like anything, Dr. Lorenson?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: A cup of coffee would be great, Sally. Thanks.

Speaker: sally
Dialogue: Is he gonna be ok?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: I hope so.

Speaker: sally
Dialogue: Me, too.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: You're going to be ok, William. We just need to get your fever down and we'll be able to hopefully stabilize you.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Who are you kidding, Doc? You or me?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Can I get some paper and something to write with.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: What for?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: I'm not gonna let that happen.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You still don't believe me, do you?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: I do believe you...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: No. Listen to me...the kid, Eugene...

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: No one knows you're working with him so how would I have found out? He's your friend's son, right?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: William, I can't indulge these delusions, even when you're in this state.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Listen to me. That's all I ask.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: He's having absence [pronounced "absance"] seizures when he stares off into space like he does. He has them so often that that's why he hasn't learned to speak properly.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Who told you this?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You did, in the future. You figured it out because a part of you already knows this. That's how it works. [Beat] I'm just telling you something you already know, even if you haven't realized it.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I don't know when it'll happen but soon I think, you'll shock the boy and it'll wake him up.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You'll figure it out and you'll do good by him.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Hey.

Speaker: talia
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Come on Eugene, try to say it with me. This is a "DOG".

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Are you having a seizure? Is that really what's going on?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Dog. [To Talia] Hi.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: You ok, Eugene?

Speaker: talia
Dialogue: What's happening?

Speaker: talia
Dialogue: But he's not epileptic.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: No, but he is having seizures.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: It worked, didn't it?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: This is really happening, isn't it?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] Thank you.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I need to get this letter to someone.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: And I can't stay here in my condition. I am going to die tonight. It's already been decided.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Yes. [Beat] It has. Everything up 'till today is done. Everything starting with tomorrow is up for grabs.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You know how to get there?

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: Sure. It's an easy address. A little far out there, but easy enough.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: lorenson
Dialogue: You want me to come with you?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: No, I'll be ok.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I remember you, too.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Jackie, how have you been?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: I've been ok.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Good. How's your mom?

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Ok, I guess.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Do you think I could see her? She looks at him and senses, like kids do, the desperation in his eyes.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: jean
Dialogue: Can I help you?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Hey, Jean. Nice to see you.

Speaker: jean
Dialogue: I'm sorry? Your face looks awfully familiar, I just can't quite place it...

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Mom, this is the guy that drove us home that afternoon we were stuck on the highway. The guy you yelled at for no good reason...

Speaker: jean
Dialogue: Oh, yeah.

Speaker: jean
Dialogue: There something you need?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You could say that.

Speaker: jean
Dialogue: Jackie, go play in the snow.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: jean
Dialogue: Just do it.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I can't stay long. [Motioning to Lorenson] That's my doctor and I gotta get back to the hospital. Everything I want to say is in this letter. [Beat] You can check as much of it as you can.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I won't be around when you read it...but I hope you believe it. It'd be a real shame if you didn't.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] I should be on my way.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Bye, Jackie.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Happy New Year to both of you.

Speaker: jean
Dialogue: Thanks. You, too.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Hey, wait!

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: [Beat] You be good to yourself, Jackie.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Ok.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I'm telling you my story because it's the only way I can try to help your daughter, and you, have a better one of your own.

Speaker: distorted voice
Dialogue: No! Wa...atch out!

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Hey there. [Beat] You ok?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I think so.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: You're bleeding pretty bad there.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: It's ok. It's ok. Relax. It's just a cut. We can get it fixed.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I fell down. [Beat] But I'm alive.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: You work there?

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Sorry, one sec.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Hey! How are you? [Beat] Thanks. I was just thinking about you, too.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Listen, I gotta go, mom, 'cause I'm late... but, thanks. Happy New Year to you, too. I'll call you later. [Beat] Ok, bye.

Speaker: jackie
Dialogue: Sorry about that. It was my mom.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: Nothin' to worry about there.

Speaker: starks
Dialogue: I'm doing fine.
